title: Enhancing Social Problem-Solving Skills through Comparative Analysis of Problem-Based Learning Case Studies

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Learners analyze real-world social issues through diverse pedagogical models, collaborating and self-directing learning in mobile-based microlearning environments

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish case problem characteristics across five problem-based instructional models: situational learning, goal-based scenarios, learning-by-design, problem-based learning, and cognitive flexibility hypertext
Learners can select appropriate instructional models for social studies dilemmas, design problems, and case analysis problems
In mobile environments, learners can analyze complex social issues from multiple perspectives and write reports proposing solutions
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
